Topic.Title: Mossberg disputes Amazon's wild claims re. Kindle Fire HD

Message.Msg: When comparing strictly on CPU performance between Omap 4470 and Tegra 3 the technical spec shows Omap has a 4 CPU cores: - dual core ARM Cortex-A9 running at a maximum of 1.8GHz - two Cortex-M3 cores running at 266MHz to handle less computationally intensive tasks while Tegra 3 has: - Up to Single Core 1.5 GHz /Quad-Core 1.4 GHz Also, comparison of memory bandwidth between Omap 4470 and Tegra shows: Omap: 7.5 GB/s Tegra: 5.3 GB/s After reviewing the specs of KF2HD it doesn’t seem to me that Kindle Fire has applications that would require a quad-processor of Tegra. The HD portion of Kindle Fire is all graphic (GPU) driven. I would understand if Kindle Fire 2 supports H.264 then Tegra would have come very handy because of the high activities in parallel processing with the decoding (CPU bound). I think Omap may have the edge on this one when used strictly with MP3 videos watching and book-reading on a 1.8 GHz CPU as compare to Nvidia 1.5 GHz single core.

Topic.Title: lol goog's 10" is coming alright, but w/Eyxnos!

Message.Msg: . "With Apple moving their "A-series" ARM chip business out of Samsung, Sammy will have massive capacity to make tons of their own Eyxnos ARM chips, and thereby Crush the little players like nvidia. This can't be good for the Tegra, right boys?" . Good point, Best. Samsung actually OWNS their fab plants -- unlike little nvidia. Eighteen (18) globally located fab plants to be exact. Making Samsung the largest semiconductor manufacturer on the planet. And at least two (2) of their fab plants have been specially built to make Apple's "A" series ARM processors. Like the A4, A5 and A5X chips, don't u know. Yep. Fabs that were built and paid off with Apple's past gigantic iOrders. So with Apple moving their A6 chip production over to TSMC, what's Samsung going to do with their aforementioned specially built ARM plants? Hummm? No. The answer is Not to go into the pigeon breeding business. Samsung is likely to go pedal-to-the-metal and flood the world with their own Eyxnos brand of ARM chips. And cheap too. Oh so cheap. Since Apple has already paid for Samsung's ARM fabs with their past gigantic iOrders. So in an indirect way, Apple moving out of Samsung's fabs is an absolute Death Knell for the nvidia Tegra. Which won't be able to compete with Samsung's flood of inexpensive Eyxnos ARM chips, Ironic, right? It sure is. Just my innocently switching vendors, Apple has likely killed-off the nvidia Tegra.. .

Message.Title: WIRED: Tablet Smackdown: Kindle Fire HD and Nexus 7
Message.Msg: And the Winner Is The best all-around Android tablet is still the Nexus #$%$ polish, speed, software and pocket-friendly size give it an edge over the fantastic Fire HD. But this misses the fact that the Kindle Fire HD isn’t trying to be just another Android tablet. Yes, Android runs through its veins, but the Fire HD is geared toward feeding Amazon’s super consumers (and creating more of those super consumers). Given that mission, the Fire HD works exactly as it should. Still, we’d rather spend our $200 on the Nexus 7.

Topic.Title: lol goog's 10" is coming alright, but w/Eyxnos!

Message.Msg: . So Best? What you're saying is, nvidia's Tegra business is mere "collateral damage", -- like road kill -- in the raging litigation battle between Apple and Samsung. And if the two weren't suing each other, Apple wouldn't be moving their A6 chips out of Samsung's fabs, causing Samsung to have a Market Crushing Amount of Fab Capacity for their own Eyxnos ARM chips. Thereby flooding the market with their own extraordinarily cheap Eyxnos ARM chips. Turning the Tegra into the aforementioned road kill. And Best, have you always been a genius at connecting-the-dots? .

Message.Title: Texas Instruments warns of weakening chip demand
Message.Msg: * Texas Instruments sees Q3 EPS of $0.38-$0.42 * Sees Q3 revenue of $3.27 bln to $3.41 bln * Says demand is at low end of previous expectation * Says looking into wireless investment changes Analysts and investors told Reuters last month that they were hoping for some wireless strategy changes at TI, which is already shutting down its wireless baseband unit but still sells application chips to run features like video and web-browsing on smartphones and tablet computers. ========================= Is TI writing off OMAP inventory and gave them for free to Amazon?

So the Market will take Jen and nvidia to the Woodshed when he indeed misses on 3Q. WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! WACK! A Ten Dollar handle ($10.XX) overnight, boys. That's how this bad movie Always ends. .

Topic.Title: Apple lost Cheyer, the second co-founder of Siri Voice Unit

Message.Msg: . Two Hundred Million Dollars ($200,000,000.00), boys. That's what Siri co-founders Dag Kittlaus and Adam Cheyer reportedly received from Apple for their phenomenal Siri invention. Two Hundred Million Dollars ($200,000,000.00) divided by the aforementioned two (2) co-founders is what? One Hundred Million Dollars ($100,000,000.00) each. Well, before taxes of course. And ibbey expects 'em to still put a tie on and show up for work? When it's, well, contractually unnecessary? . "Hello Siri, Adam here. How are the waves today at Malibu?" "Hello Adam, my master and inventor." "The waves are great, there's lots of people. Have a good time." "Shall I call work for you and tell 'em you won't be in?" "Ever, ever again." .

Topic.Title: Mossberg disputes Amazon's wild claims re. Kindle Fire HD

Message.Msg: Fire HD is a glorified very nice e-reader disguised as and trying to compete in the much more upscale tablet market and tablet prices. It will fail. But it will have a negative impact on the sales of other tablets when he takes a write down on his inventory and dumps it at fire-sale prices. If he gets away with taking only a $100M bath on this HD, he should count himself lucky. Bezos should have stayed out of the 10" market like I predicted he should have. He can't play in that market. At minimum, he does not have the OS to play there. Now we'll see whether Ballmer is smart enough to charge $350 and steal the show or keeps his nose in the air, charges $500 and varnishes into oblivion.

Topic.Title: what processor will ipad mini use?

Message.Msg: we'll find out officially in in the next hour or so what chip is in the iphone 5, but it's rumored to be a new chip, designed by apple and produced by Samsung, called the A6. According to the bloggers/pundits, the A6 is likely quad core Cortex A9s around a PowerVR GPU. Unfortunately it's very unlikely that NVDIA is a supplier in the new iphone or ipad mini. Fortunately, however, the market for non-Samsung and non-Apple smartphones and tablets is still very large (~350M units next year), and Nvidia seems positioned well. Once Icera baseband can be integrated into the SoCs (company says sometime in 2013) they should be able to get ~$40 per fully integrated SoC, based on comments NVDA CEO made with regards to competing with Intel. If they get 25% of the mkt and a blended ASP of $30, that'd be over two billion dollars in revenue, translate to 50% rev growth for the overall company. Pretty crazy, and the market seems to be pricing in a probability of near zero. But NVDA was originally guiding that Consumer Products would rise to up to $1B in the current fiscal year... before apparently missing their own internal estimates and dropping that target. If the drop in the first half of this year was actually just a hick-up and the segment has returned to the earlier growth trajectory, then $2B+ would actually be plausible.

Topic.Title: Apple A6 processor to be 22% faster than the one in previous iphhone, not 100% nor 50%

Message.Msg: dual A15 will run a whole lot faster than just 22%, Anandtech is wrong on something, that part is sure. If it looks a dual A9 process shrink/speed bump, walks like a dual A9 process shrink/speed bump, talks like a dual A9 process shrink/speed bump, it IS a dual A9 process shrink/speed bump. I'll stake my 25 yrs of product engineering experience on this one.
